meanings.definition: State or affirm something about the subject of a sentence.
meanings.sent1: She predicates her beliefs on evidence.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always predicates her lessons on real-life examples.
meanings.sent3: The detective predicates his investigation on solid clues.
meanings.sent4: His success predicates on hard work and determination.
meanings.sent5: The growth of plants predicates on sunlight and water.

meanings.definition: To base or found something on.
meanings.sent1: The decision predicates on accurate data.
meanings.sent2: They predicates their argument on historical facts.
meanings.sent3: The plan predicates on teamwork and cooperation.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness predicates on inner peace and contentment.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project predicates on careful planning and execution.
